item.title: ALANINE
item.description:
DrugBank ID: db00160
DrugCentral: alanine
Synonymous :(2s)-2-aminopropanoic acid | (s)-2-aminopropanoic acid | (s)-alanine | alanina | alanine | alaninum | l-2-aminopropionic acid | l-alanin | l-alanine | l-alpha-alanine | l-α-alanine


Drug Sentece Context


Table 1. Analysis of context sentence of alanine gene in 4 abstracts.

pmid sentence
20802350 In univarate analysis, preoperative leucocytosis, hypoxemia, raised alanine transaminase, body mass index below 18 and hypoalbuminemia were associated with a significantly reduced postoperative survival.
23656974 OC had elevated levels of ketones (aceto-acetate and β-hydroxybutyrate) and lactate compared to malignant mesotheliomas and breast carcinomas, whereas the latter had more glucose, alanine, and pyruvate.
27286996 For the purpose of this analysis, the lowest documented blood cell counts and haemoglobin levels, the highest levels of serum creatinine, aspartate aminotransferase, alanine aminotransferase and CLcr from the time of initial administration up to prior to the start of second administration were considered.
27881012 A higher AST level was also associated with higher alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and LDH level (p<0.05).
28870611 TargomiR infusions were accompanied by transient lymphopenia (25 [96%] of 26 patients), temporal hypophosphataemia (17 [65%] of 26 patients), increased aspartate aminotransferase or alanine aminotranferase (six [23%] of 26 patients), and increased alkaline phosphatase blood concentrations (two [8%]).
30660609 The most frequent grade 3 adverse events were asthenia (one [2%] in the nivolumab group vs three [5%] in the combination group), asymptomatic increase in aspartate aminotransferase or alanine aminotransferase (none vs four [7%] of each), and asymptomatic lipase increase (two [3%] vs one [2%]).
32181989 The most common adverse events included diarrhea (92%), elevated aspartate aminotransferase (61%), elevated alanine aminotransferase (54%), hair loss (38%), and vomiting (31%).
